titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Whyte Family Correspondence
titlestmt.author: compiled by Lisa Thornell

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale Center for British Art, Rare Books and Manuscripts

address.addressline: Department of Rare Books and Manuscripts

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 29, 2019 at 21:01

repository.corpname: Yale Center for British Art, Rare Books and Manuscripts

did.physdesc: 2 boxes
did.abstract: The collection comprises correspondence sent to Eva, Lizzie Hester, and Sylvie Whyte by family and friends in the 1880s and 1890s, and provides insight into the lives of adolescent girls growing up in Victorian England in the fashionable Midlands town of Malvern, and their travels abroad.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into two series: I. Correspondence; II. Printed materials. The correspondence has been arranged chronologically. Undated material follows the dated items and is arranged alphabetically by the sender's name.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Yale Center for British Art. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Whyte Family Correspondence, Yale Center for British Art, Paul Mellon Fund.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eva Anchoretta Whyte was born on May 29, 1873 in Worcestershire, England. The Indian office archives in the National Archives of the UK states that Eva married John Parke Kirkman on August 7, 1894 and that she died on June 23 1943. Lizzie Hester Whyte, also called Hester, was born on July 27, 1874 (her death date is unknown). Their mother was Sidney C. Whyte and their father, Henry Whyte, was an officer in the Madras Army. He died in 1876 when Eva and Hester were young children and subsequently is not mentioned in the correspondence. There was another Whyte sister, referred to as Sylvie in correspondence, but was listed as Sidney G. Whyte in the 1881 census (at age 4). The Whyte girls lived in Seaforth, Malvern in the 1880s and early 1890s and traveled throughout England and Ireland visiting family and friends. Malvern is located between Worcester and Hereford counties in England and was a fashionable place for the Victorians to "take the waters."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises correspondence sent to Eva, Lizzie Hester, and Sylvie Whyte by family and friends in the 1880s and 1890s and provides insight into the lives of adolescent girls growing up in Victorian England in the fashionable Midlands town of Malvern, and their travels abroad. The letters are representative of the cordial conversation and etiquette of the time. Some of the correspondence describes parties, church Bazaars, decorating the Church for the holidays, flower collecting, music, academic prizes, gossip, and family illness. The correspondence also includes frequent greetings for birthdays, Christmas, and New Year's.

The majority of letters in the collection are addressed to Eva, with other letters are addressed to Lizzie Hester and a few to all three Whyte girls. Authors of letters to Eva include Aunt Anchoretta, Aunt Charlotte, Aunt Elizabeth, Aunt Grace, Aunt Lizzie, Aunt May, cousin Lillie Stein, Henry Walter Stein, and Alice Elizabeth Stein, and friends such as Helen S. Browne, Bessey Caddich, Harriet Bell Caddich, Franny Lyne, Flossie Hennessy, Monica Hussey-Freke, Edna McCormick, May McCormick, Mary Pilson, Cynthia M. Savory, "E.H", H.S. Draper, and an "Annie" from the children' s orphanage. Authors of letters to Lizzie Hester include G.A. Lyne, Florence or Franny Lyne, and Susy McCormick. The bulk of the letters addressed to both Eva and Lizzie Hester are from their mother, Sidney C. Whyte; a number of these are written while she is in Ireland and parts of England taking care of their Aunt Harriet. Several letters also mention her taking care of an Aunt May.

Some correspondence is housed with original envelopes, which, where necessary, have been used to date the material. Series II, Printed Materials, includes a pamphlet for the Church Missionary Society, a miscellaneous newspaper clipping and calling card. All of these may have originally been sent with items of correspondence, but they have not been referred to specifically in any of the letters.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.bibref: The visitors' guide to Malvern : with observations on the air and waters, and a short description of the most interesting objects in the neighbourhood.Malvern : H.W. Lamb, 1857.

History of Malvern. Malvern : Malvern College, n.d.http://www.malcol.org/visiting/history-of-malvern/

did.physdesc: 6 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eva's aunt wishes her a happy birthday in her seventh year and mentions that an illustration was sent by another post to "hang up in your bedroom". Anchoretta also discusses a boat party in Coventry.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter written by Lillie Stein from Shepherdswell asking her cousin Eva to take a card to collect pennies which will help "teach the Irish to read the Bible in their own language" and send the card to her so that she can send it to "a lady living in Leamington". The collection card was enclosed with the letter. Lillie tells Eva that she is called the "Dover twig" for her two years of work collecting pennies. Asks that Eva say a prayer every day to ask God to bless the world.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lillie asks Eva to send her card of collected money before February 25th, either in a Postal Order or a Post Office order, made payable to "Miss E. Tisserson" of "Leamingson".

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notifies Eva that she has left Shepherdswell and moved to Pembroke Villa in Temple Ewell near Dover which is "cosy inside but not at all pretty outside." She asks Eva to continue collecting pennies for the next year and enclosed another collection card.

did.physdesc: 5 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 13 x 9 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wishes Eva a happy ninth birthday and sends her a book as her present. Assures Eva that Aunt Harriet will give her a present soon.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Banbury. Eva's aunt discusses the Beacon and Wyche Cutting in Malvern and her visit to Crouch Hill in Banbury. She mentions a boy of eight years, Spencer Hawkins, whom is staying with her sister Frances.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Mildmay Park, discussing a sale that brought in over £200 for the [illegible] Green Hospital.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wishes Eva a happy tenth birthday and sends a book for her to read to her sisters. Mentions travel plans to Scotland and asks Eva to help her make flowers into bundles.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 10 x 12 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Envelope with black (mourning) border and Malvern postal stamp.

did.physdesc: 1 page (1 leaf folded twice) ; 7 x 12 cm. + envelope and illustrated trade card. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From an unidentified sender. Addressed to St. James' Road in Great Malvern. Letter expresses "best Easter wishes" with a small trade card of Edwin A Walford, Bookseller on High Street in Banbury.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Grace, addressed to Westbourne Villa on Coswell Road and sent from Torrington. Discusses packing and leaving Torrington to go to stay with Mrs. Thorne in Dalverton. Mentions that it has not been warm enough to sketch outside, although she has done a few flower paintings. Is pleased that Eva's cough and is better and wishes her a happy birthday.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Camden Crescent in Dover. Asks if Eva has money to send for the Branch and says that she is afraid that her own contribution is not much "as some of my 'leaves' have dropped off and the 'branch' is getting bare". Mentions that she and Harry have a new Terrier puppy that they are teaching tricks.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 10 x 12 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to Seaforth in Malvern.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Park Hall in Evesham. Eva's friend discusses a holiday party that Eva missed where there was acting and dancing. The girls were dressed as different flowers, except for someone who dressed as Father Christmas. Cynthia stays "I do not feel in a writing mood, if you understand what that means....Please do not show this letter to anybody but Hester and Sylvie as it is not fit to be seen." Writing in graphite on the last page in another's handwriting which appears to be a poem.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Gilbert Street. Mentions that Eva must have enjoyed the band and going to Lord Meath's on Mondays. Discusses a visit to Smallmouth Caves where she picked up shells and to Berry Harbor where she visited a church which was being restored. Asks if Hester has drawn "many pretty things with the polygraph?"

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Charlotte addressed from Avon House in Dover. Mentions that she is sorry to have missed sending Eva's mother something for her birthday and that she would like to knit bedroom slippers for her.

did.physdesc: 10 pages (2 folded leaves and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. and smaller + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Franny Lyne addressed from Westbourne Terrace of Bray, Ireland. Tells Eva that she should write a story of all of her adventures. Discusses and church festival, various people, Eva's piano, the cold weather and the sea wall.

did.physdesc: 1 postcard ; 8 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Franny Lyne (signed with only her initials), addressed from Dublin. Thanks Eva for sending the comforter for the table "all the more as you have a sale of your own on hand" and requests that she write with the results of her sale.

did.physdesc: 8 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Franny Lyne addressed from Hatch Street in Dublin. Mentions that Mr. Lindsay purchased the muffler that Eva made for the Bazaar and that she is collecting the remains of the sale to give to Mr. Lindsay for the Children's Missionary Bazaar at Bray.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Roundwood by an illegible sender. Discusses a wedding.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to "Madam" from an address in Malvern. Letter written by W. [illegible] on behalf of someone else conveying "his best thanks to you for the beautifully copied lines you have been so kind as to send him." No postage stamp on the envelope.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 11 x 14 cm. Autographed envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to "Hester Whyte" of Seaforth Malvern. London postal stamp dated December 23 1887 and Malvern postal stamp dated December 24 1887. Annotation written in pen and black ink on front "Hester Christmas 1887" and "written by Eva May 20th 1888 with an abominable pen=one used [illegible]."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and blue ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's mother.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed from Pembroke Street. Envelope has a Dublin postage stamp. Mentions Eva's first confirmation class.

did.physdesc: 1 postcard ; 8 x 13 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Franny Lyne, stamped in Dublin and signed "F.C.H.L." Thanks Eva for sending a note about March 19 and asks if anyone has given her "[illegible] La. I" since last September, and if not, "please prevent their doing so and read word in any case next time you are writing to your mother."

did.physdesc: 8 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter sent from Franny and signed "Florence C.H. Lyne." Thanks Eva for sending her a birthday present and says she will send a confirmation present. Speaks of a marionette performance at school and mentions how wonderful it is to have Eva's mother visiting.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed to "my darlings" with envelope addressed to Eva and signed "from the loving Mother". Updates her children about her stay in Ireland.

did.physdesc: 5 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and blue ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Notes that she hasn't received a letter from Eva lately. She mentions that the chimney between the attic house and Mr. Ireland's is in a dangerous state and will be repaired. The damage was apparently caused by a fire that occurred before she arrived in the area.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Deaconess House, Mildmay Park. Wishes Eva a happy sixteenth birthday.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Liz addressed from Green Lodge thanking Eva for the cloak.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 12 x 10 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bears a London and Malvern postal stamp.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mentions that she walked behind the Chinese Ambassador down Portland Place and noticed that his shoes were "light coloured and turned up at the toes" and that he had a dark blue coat and cape. Hopes that the children are enjoying their holiday and asks for her things to be sent. Signed "much love to my darling children from their loving Mother."

did.physdesc: 2 letters, each 4 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. and smaller Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two letters written on different days and sent together to Eva from her Aunt. The first letter, written on Monday, mentions that the "millionaires got tired of North [illegible] and have left it to their servants." The second letter, written on Thursday, mentions Temple Church and the "full length figures of Crusaders in brown marble.... The woman said that they had been hidden away for 300 years."

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Portland Place. Says that she was happy to receive Eva's letter about her singing class. Signed "loving Mother."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 14 x 9 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Park Hall from Aunt Lizzie.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's mother updating her on recent travels and news.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 12 x 10 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bears a London and Malvern postal stamp.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eva's cousin speaks of how sad a time this is "that we shall never see dear Papa in this world" and that they are leaving Dover to live in London.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed "Floss" and addressed from Lancaster Gate in Hyde Park. Mentions that she is practicing the piano while writing this letter and that since they are both in the same division for piano they are going to have to "fight each other for the prize". Tells Eva that she has not sent many holiday cards and that she is going to a Christmas party at her Doctor's house.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Malvern by a sender whose name is illegible. Discusses a festival and hearing Mozart's Requiem and a symphony by Beethoven. Says "we are so glad that you like the lizard so much."

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter sent from Brighton by a friend, Edna McCormick. Gives Eva her school address. Says that she got an English prize of a "beautifully bound copy of Tennyson" and that she and Suzie got prizes for collecting wildflowers while in Malvern. Asks if Eva has had a "breaking up" party and if she remembers "the very rude things you wrote" in Green Bank.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Grace addressed from Cambridge Terrace in Hyde Park. Says that she is looking forward to reading Eva's book and that she has enclosed a separate note to congratulate Sylvie. Described a performance that she and Aunt Emily saw of Midsummer Night's Dream and a walk by the Thames.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 leave folded) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Champion Lodge, Champion Hill, S.E. Letter from an illegible sender which says "is no good my writing nicely to you as you know how I write" an then goes on to say "Her and Val are fighting over their places for tea and I am writing on my lap as they are at the table". Also says that the old dressmaker is making her frocks and that she can only bring three to school.

did.physdesc: 8 pages (2 folded leaves) ; cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed "Floss" and addressed from Lancaster Gate in Hyde Park W. Discusses plays, practicing the piano and mentions that she has been to the dentist and had three teeth "stopped" and one out.

did.physdesc: 8 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Mildmay House on Northumberland Road. Wishes Eva a happy seventeenth birthday.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Louisa addressed from Green Bank, Malvern. Expresses interest in seeing Eva's wildflower collection and mentions a visit to Christ Church and the deaths of two people.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Belford, Malvern. Requests to see Eva's sketches. Recounts a visit to St. Paul. Mentions that Constance is having several cricket matches and picnics, Edith is going to get rid of her donkey and get a pony for her carriage and that she is going to the Club to play croquet with Miss Roberts.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in and pen and black ink with small watercolor sketch on first leaf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Edna McCormick addressed from St. Matthews Vicarage in Brighton. A small watercolor sketch of a landscape is at the top left of the first page. Thanks Eva for sending "bits of Hemlock" since she hasn't been able to find any and they "seem scarce".

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 11 x 9 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brighton and Malvern postal stamps.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Mary Pilson. Mentions that Arthur received a prize, two books on botany, for the collection of wildflowers that he made over the summer holiday. Apologizes for sending a "dry old letter".

did.physdesc: 1 leaf ; 23 x 18 cm. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Belated birthday note which was sent with a present saying "is it 'better late than never'?"

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. + envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Bessey Caddich addressed from Edgbaston. Apologizes for not sending her renewal forms with Bell's for the "G.U."

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Flossie Hennessy addressed from Lancaster Gate in Hyde Park. Thanks Eva for sending the Gleaners' Union papers and asks if she has gotten any prizes in school.

did.physdesc: 11 pages (3 folded leaves) ; 20 x 16 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter written on February 27th and 28th. The first letter is signed by Florence Lyne and the second part is signed with her initials "F C [illegible] L". Expresses her sadness in losing her sister and details the funeral. Also speaks about her mother's illness, denial about the loss of her daughter and then describes the worsening of her mother's illness and fever until her eventual passing.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed from Belford, Malvern. Discusses a toothache and having teeth "stopped". Details the presents that she has received, her new pony and carriage. Mentions that "Mrs. Whyte must be so pleased at having got so [illegible] and active again as she was an invalid so long!"

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 16 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed from St. Matthews Vicarage.

unittitle.emph: Letter to Eva and Lizzie Hester Whyte

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Says that she is pleased that Eva liked the lock of Fanny's hair that she sent. Enclosed a confirmation card for Hester.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Harriet Bell Caddich addressed from Dorset House. Enclosed a photograph of herself for Eva's birthday and says that she will have more photographs taken of herself at her coming out party. Mentions that her father has gotten the family a Bechstein piano.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's friend, Winifred. Addressed from St. John's Vicarage, Newport. Wishes Eva a happy birthday and "top of the morning to you and may you live in peace and plenty to the end of your life, and may all your enemies be ground to powder". Discusses a conference that is going on. Gives Eva advice to "always walk with your toes well turned and never drop your H's." Ends the letter by quoting Brutus in Shakespeare (Act V Scene I)and signing off as "your loving friend and counselor".

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Helen S. Browne addressed from Cavendish Lodge. Encloses a photograph of herself and asks for one in return.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 10 x 12 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to "Miss Whyte" of Seaforth Malvern, Worcestershire. Malvern postal stamp on June 6 1891. Notes in pencil on reverse.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in graphite and pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Liz addressed from Adderbury.

did.physdesc: 5 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written before Eva left for Ireland in hopes it would be forwarded to her address there. Talks about making sketches and collecting hemlock specimens.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Belford, Malvern. Discusses her Aunt's rheumatism, people that she has seen and what they are doing, as well as a garden party at Malvern Wells that she planned to attend on August 29th.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Southdown Terrace. Thanks Eva for the photograph, decides to give up collecting hemlock because "it not improving to the temper," discusses a picnic in Bramba and the prospect of receiving more letters.

did.physdesc: 8 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 16 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from May McCormick addressed from St. Matthews Vicarage in Brighton, filled with humorous stories.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 11 cm. + envelope and piece of addressed paper. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from May McCormick addressed from St. Matthews Vicarage. Thanks Eva for sending her an illustrated book for her birthday. Tells her that the Protestant Congress will be held in Brighton on October 14th and that several of the speakers will stay at their home. Ends the letter because she is going to a Temperance lecture by Mr. (Richard?) Coad.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Grace addressed from Brampton Rise. Briefly mentions a rock called Toad Rock that "everyone comes to T. Wells is supposed to see." Tunbridge Wells postal stamp on envelope.

[Before geologists were able to explain its origin, Toad Rock aroused much speculation, including the idea that it was possibly man-made. Some nineteenth century observers believed that it was 'the remains of an ancient sphinx', and as late as 1933 H G Wells referred to this idea in his novel Christiana Alberta's Father. The Toad was in fact eroded into its present forms by wind action during the last Ice Age. As a result of this geological history, the surrounding area was designated a geological Site of Special Scientific Interest in 1992.]

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 leaf folded) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Louisa addressed from St. Albans. Thanks Eva for sending a book for her birthday and asks her to thank her mother for "taking the Working Party".

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from "Bell" Caddich addressed from Dorset House in Edgbaston.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from May McCormick addressed from St. Matthew's Vicarage in Brighton. Discusses "slaving away at the church decorations". Confides that her other misfortunes are that her servants are leaving New Years Day and that it is late and Christmas Eve dinner has not been served.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed from The Crescent in Weymouth. Sender had enclosed "forms filled in and P.D for 4 which we feel is all we can manage this year."

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Annie M. [illegible]. Apologizes for not sending Eva a "renewal form," mentions the Gleaners and says "we are all laid up with influenza."

did.physdesc: 6 pages (2 folded leaves) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From an unknown sender. Addressed from Withersfield Lodge, Malvern Link. No postal stamp on the envelope.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Alicia addressed from Weymouth. Says she cannot attend "the meeting" but is glad to hear that there is one. No postal stamp on the envelope.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (2 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Mildmay Park. Wishes Eva a happy birthday. Tells her that she had a tea party for 1200 poor people and "they behaved so well and greatly enjoyed themselves" and another tea for 400 railway men. The Duchess of Edinburgh's three children spent three hours with the party for the railway men and enjoyed themselves.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 11 x 9 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Says that she heard that the "orphanage enlarged the children collected £35 for it and we all gave something altogether over £200."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Dublin by "Annie," at a children's orphanage. Annie says that her sister had met Eva on the steamer going to Holyhead and had passed on Eva's collection of money for the children. Tells Eva that there are 63 girls and 45 boys at the home. Had enclosed a photograph of a little girl in the home named Maggie Powell.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from "Aunt Elizabeth" addressed from Seaforth, Malvern.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from "Aunt Emily" addressed from West Devon. Wishes Eva a happy birthday and updates her on various news.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Aunt Lizzie addressed from Seaforth, Malvern. Tells the story of a wet kitten found in the bed of aunt Grace.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Bell Caddich addressed from "Wellington Road, Idgbaston". Tells Eva that she enjoyed the "The Days of Bruce" and recounts a dance that she attended where she met "almost 6 to 8 gentleman at once."

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Bessey Caddich addressed from Wellington Road, Edgbaston with "E.M. Caddich" written with serifs on the first leave.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from "E.H." and addressed from Green Lodge.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from "E. H." addressed from Seaforth.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter addressed from Belford, Malvern. Discusses a sale where there were "no ices." Says that her father bought "Beauty of Glazenwood" roses and an orchid. Reports that Edith has bought a new pony.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Belford, Malvern. Tells Eva that Auntie Loo[?] "finished bathing" but does not feel improved. " I hope she will feel the benefits after as it's such a waste of time trouble and money." Discusses a garden party at the Weirs at Malvern Wells that 150 people attended and the anticipated arrival of the Duke and Duchess of Teck, which the Vicar is preparing for by trying to get a "Guard of Honour and the bells rung."

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Belford, Malvern. Birthday wishes and sends a "night dress case" as a present.

did.physdesc: 1 page ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Says that she has been too busy decorating the church to buy presents or send cards.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's cousin, Henry Walter Stein, addressed from Shepherdswell. Tells Eva that he has a guinea pig, kitten, a cat, rabbit and pigeons. Says that children in the village have the measles but "we hope we shall not get it."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Camden Crescent, Dover. Mentions that the bullfinches are out and that the "birds are quite well", decorating the church and wishes the Whyte family a happy Christmas.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thinks that Aunt Harriet is a little better but is still seriously ill and cannot think of leaving her. Wants her children to remember that she is taking care of their Aunt because she has no daughters of her own to take care of her.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on various news.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter to her daughter updating her on what she has been doing. Lets Eva know where her red hair ribbons are stored.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on various news and travel plans to Dublin.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from London. Updates her daughter on various news.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and blue ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wishes that she could see Eva's prize and asks her to thank Aunt Liz for the parcel.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter signed; written in graphite.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on various news.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 14 x 9 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and blue ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wishes Eva a happy Christmas and says she just discovered the "sweet little knife" and to thank Hester.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on news from Alice Stein.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and 1 additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from London. Details her journey from Worcester to London.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and brown ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Shepherdswell from Eva's aunt.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From an unknown sender. Addressed from Withersfield Lodge, Malvern Link. Talks of feeling "quite poorly."

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From an unknown sender. Mentions visiting London twice, going to the Grosvenor Gallery and wanting to go to the Dulwich Gallery to "see the pictures there."

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed from Beaumont Street. Says that she does not expect to be home in a fortnight.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's friend, Winifred. Addressed from St. John's Vicarage, Newport. Asks Eva to help with their "sale of work" and that she should be glad to have something to occupy her time since she is a "young lady at home." Mentions that she and Jess "do a little in the Educational Department" and that Jess has left school so they take turns instructing their "juvenile sister."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Eva's friend, Winifred. Addressed from St. John's Vicarage, Newport. Thanks Eva for the parcel of things for the "sale" and reports that Cara has gone for the "3rd class College of Preceptors" and hopes that she will pass.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 12 x 9 cm. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to "my dear [illegible] child". Possibly sent from Eva's grandmother.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 14 x 9 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From an unknown sender giving Christmas and New Years greetings.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 7 x 12 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and brown ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to Eva Whyte in Seaforth with annotation on front "with Mrs. Pear's [?] love." There are no postal stamps.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 13 x 9 cm. Autographed letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Hester's aunt, signed "G.M. H." Tells about seeing the Queen's crown and jewels in the Tower and seeing the block on which "some Lords were beheaded."

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from a friend, "Susy" McCormick, addressed from Pembroke House with two entries on two different dates. On October 11th she says that she is not allowed to write letters at school except on Saturday. On October 18th she writes that she is busy with school lessons.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 15 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on various news and hopes she will be coming home soon to see her children.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Says she will give Hester money for presents. Updates her on various news and travel.

did.physdesc: 3 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 16 x 10 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her daughter on Aunt May's health and various news.

did.physdesc: 1 envelope ; 10 x 12 cm. Autograph envelope; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addressed to "L.H. Whyte" in Seaforth. There are no postal stamps.

did.physdesc: 1 page ; 14 x 9 cm. +envelope. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relays a message from Mr. Frank Farnie that he will accept "the Misses Whyte's kind invitation for the 15th" and also says that Mr. Willie Farnie will not attend.

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leave and additional smaller leave) ; 18 x 12 cm. and smaller Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Fanny Lyne addressed from Dublin. Christmas and New Year's wishes "to both generations of our friends at Seaforth." Mentions decorating the tree at the Children's hospital in the "Victoria Ward" and making twice the amount anticipated at the "sale of the things off the tree."

did.physdesc: 6 pages (1 folded leaf and additional leaf) ; 18 x 12 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Updates her children on various news since she last saw them.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leaf) ; 18 x 11 cm. Autograph letter signed; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Asks if they saw the eclipse on Saturday evening. Mentions that Punch and Judy was "one of the amusements" at the Health Exhibition party.

did.physdesc: 2 pages (1 leaf) ; 14 x 12 cm. Autograph letter; written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sends the children's Christmas cards and hope that they do not object to getting them so soon.

did.physdesc: 1 page ; 18 x 12 cm. Written in pen and black ink.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Listing of five names and addresses.

did.physdesc: 4 pages (1 folded leave) ; 19 x 13 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Facts about the Church Missionary Society located at Salisbury Square, Fleet Street, E.C. This pamphlet may have been associated with one of the three pieces of correspondence addressed to Eva from her friend Winifred, within the undated folder of Series I: Correspondence.

did.physdesc: 1 sheet ; 52 x 10 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clipping of an article titled "Killing the Golden Eagle" which appeared on page 5 of an unidentified newspaper. The article discusses the appearance of a rare golden eagle flying over "the Royal residence at Bagshot" which was shot down by "one of her majesty's keepers". Pen and ink handwriting at the top of the article reads "to you a genteel lady always genteel".

unittitle.emph: Calling card of "Miss Ethel Fitton" of "Fairlea, Malvern"

did.physdesc: 1 card ; 6 x 9 cm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black ink letterpress printed on green paper. "Eva Whyte" is handwritten on the card in graphite which may have been added at a later date.
